intro: Hermannia diversistipula var. graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features erect, branching stems covered in soft, glandular hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
